alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Indiana; Jefferson; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 6:31AM EST until January 14 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania... Southeastern Jefferson County in west central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southeastern Armstrong County in west central Pennsylvania... * Until 700 AM EST. * At 631 AM EST, a hazardous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Sandy to 7 miles east of Apollo, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 90 and 96. Locations impacted include... Indiana, Punxsutawney, Vandergrift, Homer City, Apollo, Blairsville, Reynoldsville, Black Lick, Clymer, North Apollo, Sykesville, Falls Creek, Avonmore, Orchard Hills, Rural Valley, Saltsburg, Oklahoma, West Lebanon, New Florence, and East Vandergrift. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
